channel.title: theBalancedBriefNLtech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from theBalancedBriefNLtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Magnesium Supplements Crash Course (2026): Benefits and Side Effects
item.description: Promises of better sleep—and better poops—are driving the magnesium supplements craze.

item.title: ‘Shogun’ Creator Says Season 2 ‘Defies Expectations’
item.description: The historical series Shogun was an international hit that won a record 18 Emmy Awards. With production on season 2 starting, the writer and executive...

item.title: AI Deepfakes Are Impersonating Pastors to Try to Scam Their Congregations
item.description: Religious communities around the US are getting hit with AI depictions of their leaders sharing incendiary sermons and asking for donations.

item.title: 9 Best Cat Water Fountains, WIRED-Tested and Reviewed (2025)
item.description: Ensuring your cat is drinking enough water is one of the best ways to keep your pet healthy. We tested nearly two dozen models to find the best water ...

item.title: LG’s new OLED TV is just 9mm thick
item.description: This year LG is showing off its manufacturing chops at CES with a new Wallpaper OLED TV that is just 9mm thick.

item.title: Amazon’s AI assistant comes to the web with Alexa.com

item.title: Google previews new Gemini features for TV at CES 2026
item.description: Google TV will let you ask Gemini to find and edit your photos, adjust your TV settings and more.

item.title: Samsung Galaxy Z Trifold Hands On: This Is the Phone-Tablet Hybrid You're Looking For
item.description: At CES 2026, we went hands-on with the three-panel Samsung tablet that folds up to the size of a (large) phone.

item.title: Luminar claims founder Austin Russell is dodging a subpoena in the bankruptcy case
item.description: The Luminar founder claims he has been cooperative.

item.title: Amazon revamps Fire TV, launches its own ‘Artline’ televisions with frames at CES
item.description: Fire TV's new interface focuses on your content and offers easier, speedier navigation, Amazon says.
